summary.long: Zechariah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord came to the prophet Zechariah son of Berechiah son of Iddo, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord was very angry with your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say to them: Thus says the Lord of hosts: Return to me, says the Lord of hosts, and I will return to you, says the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be like your ancestors, to whom the former prophets proclaimed, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts: Return from your evil ways and from your evil deeds.’ But they did not hear or heed me, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your ancestors, where are they? And the prophets, do they live forever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my words and my statutes, which I commanded my servants the prophets, did they not overtake your ancestors? So they repented and said, ‘The Lord of hosts has dealt with us according to our ways and deeds, just as he planned to do.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, the month of Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord came to the prophet Zechariah son of Berechiah son of Iddo:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the night I saw a man mounted on a red horse! He was standing among the myrtle trees in the shadows, and behind him were red, sorrel, and white horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “What are these, my lord?” The angel who spoke with me said to me, “I will show you what they are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man who was standing among the myrtle trees answered, “They are those whom the Lord has sent to patrol the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they spoke to the angel of the Lord who was standing among the myrtle trees, “We have patrolled the earth, and the whole earth remains at peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord said, “O Lord of hosts, how long will you withhold mercy from Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, with which you have been angry these seventy years?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord replied with gracious and comforting words to the angel who spoke with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the angel who spoke with me said to me, “Proclaim this message: Thus says the Lord of hosts: I am very zealous for Jerusalem and for Zion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I am extremely angry with the nations that are at ease, for while I was only a little angry, they made the disaster worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, thus says the Lord: I have returned to Jerusalem with compassion; my house shall be built in it, says the Lord of hosts, and a measuring line shall be stretched out over Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Proclaim further: Thus says the Lord of hosts: My cities shall again overflow with prosperity; the Lord will again comfort Zion and again choose Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I looked up and saw four horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I asked the angel who spoke with me, “What are those?” And he answered me, “Those are the horns that have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord showed me four blacksmiths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I asked, “What are they coming to do?” He answered, “Those are the horns that scattered Judah, so that no head could be raised, but these have come to terrify them, to strike down the horns of the nations that lifted up their horns against the land of Judah to scatter its people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I looked up and saw a man with a measuring line in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I asked, “Where are you going?” He answered me, “To measure Jerusalem, to see how wide and how long it is.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel who spoke with me came forward, and another angel came forward to meet him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Run, say to that young man: Jerusalem shall be inhabited like unwalled villages because of the multitude of people and animals in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will be a wall of fire all around it, says the Lord, and I will be the glory within it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Up, up! Flee from the land of the north, says the Lord, for I have spread you abroad like the four winds of heaven, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Up! Escape to Zion, you who live with daughter Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus said the Lord of hosts after his glory sent me to the nations who plundered you: Truly, one who touches you touches the apple of my eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am going to raise my hand against them, and they shall become plunder for their own slaves. Then you will know that the Lord of hosts has sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing and rejoice, O daughter Zion! For I will come and dwell in your midst, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many nations shall join themselves to the Lord on that day and shall be my people, and I will dwell in your midst. And you shall know that the Lord of hosts has sent me to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will inherit Judah as his portion in the holy land and will again choose Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be silent, all flesh, before the Lord, for he has roused himself from his holy dwelling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he showed me the high priest Joshua standing before the angel of the Lord and the accuser standing at his right hand to accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to the accuser, “The Lord rebuke you, O accuser! The Lord who has chosen Jerusalem rebuke you! Is not this man a brand plucked from the fire?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joshua was wearing filthy clothes as he stood before the angel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to those who were standing before him, “Take off his filthy clothes.” And to him he said, “See, I have taken your guilt away from you, and I will clothe you with festal apparel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Let them put a clean turban on his head.” So they put a clean turban on his head and clothed him with apparel, and the angel of the Lord was standing by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord warned Joshua, saying
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts: If you will walk in my ways and keep my requirements, then you shall rule my house and have charge of my courts, and I will give you the right of access among those who are standing here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now listen, Joshua, high priest, you and your colleagues who sit before you! For they are an omen of things to come: I am going to bring my servant the Branch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For on the stone that I have set before Joshua, on a single stone with seven facets, I will engrave its inscription, says the Lord of hosts, and I will remove the guilt of this land in a single day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, says the Lord of hosts, you shall invite each other to come under your vine and fig tree.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel who spoke with me came again and wakened me, as one is wakened from sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, “What do you see?” And I said, “I see a lampstand all of gold, with a bowl on the top of it; there are seven lamps on it, with seven lips on each of the lamps that are on the top of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by it there are two olive trees, one on the right of the bowl and the other on its left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said to the angel who spoke with me, “What are these, my lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel who spoke with me answered me, “Do you not know what these are?” I said, “No, my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, “This is the word of the Lord to Zerubbabel: Not by might, nor by power, but by my spirit, says the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What are you, O great mountain? Before Zerubbabel you shall become a plain, and he shall bring out the top stone amid shouts of ‘Grace, grace to it!’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The hands of Zerubbabel have laid the foundation of this house; his hands shall also complete it. Then you will know that the Lord of hosts has sent me to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For whoever has despised the day of small things shall rejoice and shall see the plummet in the hand of Zerubbabel.
“These seven are the eyes of the Lord that range through the whole earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to him, “What are these two olive trees on the right and the left of the lampstand?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a second time I said to him, “What are these two branches of the olive trees that pour out the oil through the two golden pipes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, “Do you not know what these are?” I said, “No, my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “These are the two anointed ones who stand by the Lord of the whole earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again I looked up and saw a flying scroll.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to me, “What do you see?” I answered, “I see a flying scroll; its length is twenty cubits and its width ten cubits.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to me, “This is the curse that goes out over the face of the whole land, for everyone who has stolen, as is forbidden on one side, has gone unpunished, and everyone who has sworn falsely, as is forbidden on the other side, has gone unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sent it out, says the Lord of hosts, and it shall enter the house of the thief and the house of anyone who swears falsely by my name, and it shall abide in that house and consume it, both timber and stones.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel who spoke with me came forward and said to me, “Look up and see what this is that is coming out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said, “What is it?” He said, “This is a basket coming out.” And he said, “This is their iniquity in the whole land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a leaden cover was lifted, and there was a woman sitting in the basket!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “This is Wickedness.” So he thrust her back into the basket and pressed the leaden weight down on its mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I looked up and saw two women coming forward. The wind was in their wings; they had wings like the wings of a stork, and they lifted up the basket between earth and sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to the angel who spoke with me, “Where are they taking the basket?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, “To the land of Shinar, to build a house for it, and when this is prepared, they will set it down there on its base.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again I looked up and saw four chariots coming out from between two mountains—mountains of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first chariot had red horses, the second chariot black horses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third chariot white horses, and the fourth chariot dappled gray horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to the angel who spoke with me, “What are these, my lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered me, “These are the four winds of heaven going out, after presenting themselves before the Lord of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chariot with the black horses goes toward the north country, the white ones go toward the west country, and the dappled ones go toward the south country.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the steeds came out, they were impatient to get off and patrol the earth. And he said, “Go, patrol the earth.” So they patrolled the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he cried out to me, “See, those who go toward the north country have set my spirit at rest in the north country.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Collect silver and gold from the exiles—from Heldai, Tobijah, and Jedaiah—who have arrived from Babylon, and go the same day to the house of Josiah son of Zephaniah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the silver and gold and make a crown and set it on the head of the high priest Joshua son of Jehozadak;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: say to him: Thus says the Lord of hosts: Here is a man whose name is Branch, for he shall branch out in his place, and he shall build the temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is he who shall build the temple of the Lord; he shall bear royal honor and shall sit upon his throne and rule. There shall be a priest by his throne, with peaceful understanding between the two of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crown shall be in the care of Heldai, Tobijah, Jedaiah, and Josiah son of Zephaniah, as a memorial in the temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Those who are far off shall come and help to build the temple of the Lord, and you shall know that the Lord of hosts has sent me to you. This will happen if you diligently obey the voice of the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourth year of King Darius, the word of the Lord came to Zechariah on the fourth day of the ninth month, which is Chislev.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the people of Bethel had sent Sharezer and Regem-melech and their men to entreat the favor of the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to ask the priests of the house of the Lord of hosts and the prophets, “Should I mourn and practice abstinence in the fifth month, as I have done for so many years?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord of hosts came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to all the people of the land and the priests: When you fasted and lamented in the fifth month and in the seventh for these seventy years, was it for me that you fasted?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you eat and when you drink, do you not eat and drink only for yourselves?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were not these the words that the Lord proclaimed by the former prophets, when Jerusalem was inhabited and in prosperity, along with the towns around it, and when the Negeb and the Shephelah were inhabited?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Zechariah, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts: Render true judgments, show kindness and mercy to one another;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: do not oppress the widow, the orphan, the alien, or the poor; and do not devise evil in your hearts against one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they refused to listen and turned a stubborn shoulder and stopped their ears in order not to hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made their hearts adamant in order not to hear the law and the words that the Lord of hosts had sent by his spirit through the former prophets. Therefore great wrath came from the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as, when I called, they would not hear, so, when they called, I would not hear, says the Lord of hosts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I scattered them with a whirlwind among all the nations that they had not known. Thus the land they left was desolate, so that no one went to and fro, and a pleasant land was made desolate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord of hosts came to me, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts: I am zealous for Zion with great zeal, and I am zealous for her with great wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: I will return to Zion and will dwell in the midst of Jerusalem; Jerusalem shall be called the faithful city, and the mountain of the Lord of hosts shall be called the holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts: Old men and old women shall again sit in the streets of Jerusalem, each with staff in hand because of their great age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the streets of the city shall be full of boys and girls playing in its streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts: Even though it seems impossible to the remnant of this people in these days, should it also seem impossible to me, says the Lord of hosts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts: I will save my people from the east country and from the west country,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will bring them to live in Jerusalem. They shall be my people and I will be their God, in faithfulness and in righteousness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts: Let your hands be strong—you who have recently been hearing these words from the mouths of the prophets who were present when the foundation was laid for the rebuilding of the temple, the house of the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For before those days there were no wages for people or for animals, nor was there any safety from the foe for those who went out or came in, and I set them all against one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now I will not deal with the remnant of this people as in the former days, says the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there shall be a sowing of peace; the vine shall yield its fruit, the ground shall give its produce, and the skies shall give their dew, and I will cause the remnant of this people to possess all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as you have been a cursing among the nations, O house of Judah and house of Israel, so I will save you, and you shall be a blessing. Do not be afraid, but let your hands be strong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord of hosts: Just as I purposed to bring disaster upon you when your ancestors provoked me to wrath, and I did not relent, says the Lord of hosts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so again I have purposed in these days to do good to Jerusalem and to the house of Judah; do not be afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the things that you shall do: speak the truth to one another, render in your gates judgments that are true and make for peace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: do not devise evil in your hearts against one another, and love no false oath, for all these are things that I hate, says the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord of hosts came to me, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts: The fast of the fourth month, and the fast of the fifth, and the fast of the seventh, and the fast of the tenth shall be seasons of joy and gladness and cheerful festivals for the house of Judah; therefore love truth and peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts: Peoples shall yet come, the inhabitants of many cities;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the inhabitants of one city shall go to another, saying, ‘Come, let us go to entreat the favor of the Lord and to seek the Lord of hosts; I myself am going.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many peoples and strong nations shall come to seek the Lord of hosts in Jerusalem and to entreat the favor of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts: In those days ten men from nations of every language shall take hold of a Jew, grasping his garment and saying, ‘Let us go with you, for we have heard that God is with you.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An Oracle.
The word of the Lord is against the land of Hadrach
    and will rest upon Damascus.
For to the Lord belongs the capital of Aram,
    as do all the tribes of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hamath also, which borders on it,
    Tyre and Sidon, though they are very wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tyre has built itself a rampart
    and heaped up silver like dust
    and gold like the dirt of the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now, the Lord will strip it of its possessions
    and hurl its wealth into the sea,
    and it shall be devoured by fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
a mongrel people shall settle in Ashdod,
    and I will make an end of the pride of Philistia.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will encamp at my house as a guard,
    so that no one shall march to and fro;
no oppressor shall again overrun them,
    for now I have seen with my own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice greatly, O daughter Zion!
    Shout aloud, O daughter Jerusalem!
See, your king comes to you;
    triumphant and victorious is he,
humble and riding on a donkey,
    on a colt, the foal of a donkey.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As for you also, because of the blood of my covenant with you,
    I will set your prisoners free from the waterless pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return to your stronghold, O prisoners of hope;
    today I declare that I will restore to you double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I have bent Judah as my bow;
    I have made Ephraim its arrow.
I will arouse your sons, O Zion,
    against your sons, O Greece,
    and wield you like a warrior’s sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord will appear over them,
    and his arrow go forth like lightning;
the Lord God will sound the trumpet
    and march forth in the whirlwinds of the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of hosts will protect them,
    and they shall consume and conquer the slingers;
they shall drink their blood like wine
    and be full like a bowl,
    drenched like the corners of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On that day the Lord their God will save them,
    for they are the flock of his people,
for like the jewels of a crown
    they shall shine on his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For what goodness and beauty are his!
    Grain shall make the young men flourish,
    and new wine the young women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ask rain from the Lord
    in the season of the spring rain,
from the Lord who makes the storm clouds,
    who gives showers of rain to you,
    the vegetation in the field to everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My anger is hot against the shepherds,
    and I will punish the leaders,
for the Lord of hosts cares for his flock, the house of Judah,
    and will make them like his proud war horse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of them shall come the cornerstone,
    out of them the tent peg,
out of them the battle bow,
    out of them every commander.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Together they shall be like warriors in battle,
    trampling the foe in the mud of the streets;
they shall fight, for the Lord is with them,
    and they shall put to shame the riders on horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will strengthen the house of Judah,
    and I will save the house of Joseph.
I will bring them back because I have compassion on them,
    and they shall be as though I had not rejected them,
    for I am the Lord their God, and I will answer them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the people of Ephraim shall become like warriors,
    and their hearts shall be glad as with wine.
Their children shall see it and rejoice;
    their hearts shall exult in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Though I scattered them among the nations,
    yet in far countries they shall remember me,
    and they shall rear their children and return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bring them home from the land of Egypt
    and gather them from Assyria;
I will bring them to the land of Gilead and to Lebanon,
    until there is no room for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall pass through the sea of distress,
    and the waves of the sea shall be struck down,
    and all the depths of the Nile dried up.
The pride of Assyria shall be laid low,
    and the scepter of Egypt shall depart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make them strong in the Lord,
    and they shall walk in his name,
            says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open your doors, O Lebanon,
    so that fire may devour your cedars!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wail, O cypress, for the cedar has fallen,
    for the glorious trees are ruined!
Wail, oaks of Bashan,
    for the thick forest has been felled!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, the wail of the shepherds,
    for their glory is despoiled!
Listen, the roar of the lions,
    for the thickets of the Jordan are destroyed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord my God: Be a shepherd of the flock doomed to slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who buy them kill them and go unpunished, and those who sell them say, ‘Blessed be the Lord, for I have become rich,’ and their own shepherds have no pity on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will no longer have pity on the inhabitants of the earth, says the Lord. I will cause them, every one, to fall each into the hand of a neighbor and each into the hand of the king, and they shall devastate the earth, and I will deliver no one from their hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So on behalf of the sheep merchants, I became the shepherd of the flock doomed to slaughter. I took two staffs; one I named Favor, the other I named Unity, and I tended the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In one month I disposed of the three shepherds, for I had become impatient with them, and they also detested me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I said, “I will not be your shepherd. What is to die, let it die; what is to be destroyed, let it be destroyed; and let those that are left devour the flesh of one another!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I took my staff Favor and broke it, annulling the covenant that I had made with all the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was annulled on that day, and the sheep merchants who were watching me knew that it was the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I then said to them, “If it seems right to you, give me my wages, but if not, keep them.” So they weighed out as my wages thirty shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Throw it into the treasury”—this lordly price at which I was valued by them. So I took the thirty shekels of silver and threw them into the treasury in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I broke my second staff Unity, annulling the family ties between Judah and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me: “Take once more the implements of a worthless shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am now raising up in the land a shepherd who does not care for the perishing, or seek the wandering, or heal the maimed, or nourish the healthy, but devours the flesh of the fat ones, tearing off even their hoofs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, my worthless shepherd,
    who deserts the flock!
May the sword strike his arm
    and his right eye!
Let his arm be completely withered,
    his right eye utterly blinded!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An Oracle.
The word of the Lord concerning Israel: Thus says the Lord, who stretched out the heavens and founded the earth and formed the human spirit within:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I am about to make Jerusalem a cup of reeling for all the surrounding peoples; it will be against Judah also in the siege against Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day I will make Jerusalem a heavy stone for all the peoples; all who lift it shall grievously hurt themselves. And all the nations of the earth shall come together against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, says the Lord, I will strike every horse with panic and its rider with madness. But on the house of Judah I will keep a watchful eye, when I strike every horse of the peoples with blindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the clans of Judah shall say to themselves, “The inhabitants of Jerusalem have strength through the Lord of hosts, their God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day I will make the clans of Judah like a blazing pot on a pile of wood, like a flaming torch among sheaves, and they shall devour to the right and to the left all the surrounding peoples, while Jerusalem shall again be inhabited in its place, in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord will save the tents of Judah first, that the glory of the house of David and the glory of the inhabitants of Jerusalem may not be exalted over that of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day the Lord will shield the inhabitants of Jerusalem so that the feeblest among them on that day shall be like David, and the house of David shall be like God, like the angel of the Lord, at their head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on that day I will seek to destroy all the nations that come against Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will pour out a spirit of compassion and supplication on the house of David and the inhabitants of Jerusalem so that, when they look on the one whom they have pierced, they shall mourn for him as one mourns for an only child and weep bitterly over him as one weeps over a firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day the mourning in Jerusalem will be as great as the mourning for Hadad-rimmon in the plain of Megiddo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land shall mourn, each family by itself; the family of the house of David by itself and their wives by themselves; the family of the house of Nathan by itself and their wives by themselves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the family of the house of Levi by itself and their wives by themselves; the family of the Shimeites by itself and their wives by themselves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the families that are left, each by itself and their wives by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day a fountain shall be opened for the house of David and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, to cleanse them from sin and impurity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, says the Lord of hosts, I will cut off the names of the idols from the land, so that they shall be remembered no more, and also I will remove from the land the prophets and the unclean spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if any prophets appear again, their fathers and mothers who bore them will say to them, “You shall not live, for you speak lies in the name of the Lord,” and their fathers and their mothers who bore them shall pierce them through when they prophesy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day the prophets will be ashamed, every one, of their visions when they prophesy; they will not put on a hairy mantle in order to deceive,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but each of them will say, “I am no prophet; I am a tiller of the soil, for the land has been my possession since my youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone asks them, “What are these wounds on your chest?” the answer will be “The wounds I received in the house of my friends.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Awake, O sword, against my shepherd,
    against the man who is my associate,”
            says the Lord of hosts.
“Strike the shepherd, that the sheep may be scattered;
    I will turn my hand against the little ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the whole land, says the Lord,
    two-thirds shall be cut off and perish,
    and one-third shall be left alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will put this third into the fire,
    refine them as one refines silver,
    and test them as gold is tested.
They will call on my name,
    and I will answer them.
I will say, ‘They are my people,’
    and they will say, ‘The Lord is our God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, a day is coming for the Lord, when the plunder taken from you will be divided in your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will gather all the nations against Jerusalem to battle, and the city shall be taken and the houses plundered and the women raped; half the city shall go into exile, but the rest of the people shall not be cut off from the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord will go forth and fight against those nations as when he fights on a day of battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day his feet shall stand on the Mount of Olives, which lies before Jerusalem on the east, and the Mount of Olives shall be split in two from east to west by a very wide valley, so that one half of the mount shall withdraw northward and the other half southward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall flee by the valley of the Lord’s mountain, for the valley between the mountains shall reach to Azal, and you shall flee as you fled from the earthquake in the days of King Uzziah of Judah. Then the Lord my God will come and all the holy ones with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day there shall not be either cold or frost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there shall be continuous day (it is known to the Lord), not day and not night, for at evening time there shall be light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day living water shall flow out from Jerusalem, half of it to the eastern sea and half of it to the western sea; it shall continue in summer as in winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord will become king over all the earth; on that day the Lord will be one and his name one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole land shall be turned into a plain from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem. But Jerusalem shall remain aloft on its site from the Gate of Benjamin to the place of the former gate, to the Corner Gate, and from the Tower of Hananel to the king’s winepresses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be inhabited, for never again shall it be doomed to destruction; Jerusalem shall abide in security.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be the plague with which the Lord will strike all the peoples who wage war against Jerusalem: their flesh shall rot while they are still on their feet, their eyes shall rot in their sockets, and their tongues shall rot in their mouths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day a great panic from the Lord shall fall on them, so that each will seize the hand of a neighbor, and the hand of the one will be raised against the hand of the other;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even Judah will fight at Jerusalem. And the wealth of all the surrounding nations shall be collected: gold, silver, and garments in great abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a plague like this plague shall fall on the horses, the mules, the camels, the donkeys, and whatever animals may be in those camps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all who survive of the nations that have come against Jerusalem shall go up year after year to worship the King, the Lord of hosts, and to keep the Festival of Booths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any of the families of the earth do not go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, the Lord of hosts, there will be no rain upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the family of Egypt do not go up and present themselves, there will be no rain for them; there will be the plague that the Lord inflicts on the nations that do not go up to keep the Festival of Booths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such shall be the punishment of Egypt and the punishment of all the nations that do not go up to keep the Festival of Booths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day there shall be inscribed on the bells of the horses, “Holy to the Lord.” And the cooking pots in the house of the Lord shall be as holy as the bowls in front of the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every cooking pot in Jerusalem and Judah shall be holy to the Lord of hosts, so that all who sacrifice may come and use them to boil the flesh of the sacrifice. And there shall no longer be traders in the house of the Lord of hosts on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator
